page.title: 08Cotton End Baptist Church
page.content: An independent meeting was held in Cotton End from the seventeenth century but the first meeting house was constructed on the present site in 1777. Todays building dates from 1836/7. Cotton End has been a centre of nonconformity from the seventeenth century and a notable academy for the training of congregational ministers and missionaries was based here in the nineteenth century. Services today are well attended with approximately 35 to 40 adults and 20 children congregating on a Sunday. The two Sunday services are held at 11 a.m. and 6 p.m. with a Sunday School for the children in the morning and a Bible Study and Prayer meeting on Tuesdays.
